channel.title: Admin

item.title: Admin
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

blakeman8192:

Hey Lothy, why don’t we tell everyone about the PvPscape rigged source where you can access an admin account at any times? Oh, and how you get on and fuck around with servers and drop partyhats all over the place and cause the owners to reset every account? I know your bullshit from first-hand experience.

Go for it. I don’t care, Javac doesn’t care, none of the other CMs care. The only person too incompetent to remove what was allowing me to become admin was you. I even told your friend Dylan exactly how to do it. He either didn’t pass those on to you, or you just had no idea because you never l2Java before. Either way, I could care less.

Back on topic - Just add a command like this, and type it in game. It will only work for the name you put in the playerName.equalsIgnoreCase bit:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("admin") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("yourName")) { playerRights = 2; }

Read full topic

item.title: Admin
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

blakeman8192:

I don’t see that anywhere. You have it set to being 3, did you change that to 2? If so, you can avoid all of this by logging your account out, going into the charachter file, making the rights 2, and logging back in. It doesnt work when ur logged in because when you log out to reset your account it just overwrites the player file to how it was before it got logged out, so the changes you make while it is logged in takes no effect.

He’s using testscape moron.

Read full topic

If so, you can avoid all of this by logging your account out, going into the charachter file, making the rights 2, and logging back in. It doesnt work when ur logged in because when you log out to reset your account it just overwrites the player file to how it was before it got logged out, so the changes you make while it is logged in takes no effect.

item.title: Admin
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:10, topic:57271”][quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=81483.msg887700#msg887700 date=1171204924]
Javaisnotrecognized… reboot and reconnecting wont do anything. Close down your server, compile, then run it again. Should work.
If that doesnt work, use playerrights as 2. Because sometimes on some servers, 3 will only work for one account, or it wont work at all.
[/quote]
That’s incredibly fucking stupid. How can playerRights = 3 not work? It’s just a variable name that you’re assigning the value ‘2’ to. So if you have in a command if(playerRights >= 2), then how could you not possibly use it if your playerRights are over 2? You could have playerRights = 10000 for all Java cares.[/quote]
And all that shit you explained still doesnt give the noob the god damn gold crown that he wants. But if you set the player rights to 2, itll give him his gold crown, admin abilities, and itll make him happy. Most servers dont have a if(playerRights >= 3){ requrement thing going in there, its usually 2, so using 3 wouldnt give you a gold crown, and wouldnt make any difference in commands vs. a normal admin.[br][size=1]Posted on: February 11, 2007, 04:01:08 AM[/size][hr]No, just set your rights to 2, you’ll be fine. 3 sucks balls.

Read full topic

item.title: Admin
item.dc:creator: @0wnz0r 0wnz0r
item.description:
@0wnz0r wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:12, topic:57271”]Sometimes 3 just doesnt work when its set for “owner title” etc.
I was speaking about the playerRights setting, no shit it would work if you had >=, because its greater then or equal to, but I’m not talking about commands and other shit. but I dont see a > anywhere in if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("yo")) { playerRights = 3; }
Duno, I guess I’m just blind.[/quote]
Your not blind… Do I need the > thing?

EDIT: If i do playerrights 2 I still am normal

Read full topic

Duno, I guess I’m just blind.[/quote]

No;

0 = regular player, you suck
1 = player mod, you have no life
2 = Jagex mod, you suck and have no life
3 = Jagex mod but you can’t see your crown, so you don’t even know that you suck.

item.title: Admin
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:11, topic:57271”][quote author=lothy link=topic=81483.msg887713#msg887713 date=1171205181]

Javaisnotrecognized… reboot and reconnecting wont do anything. Close down your server, compile, then run it again. Should work.
If that doesnt work, use playerrights as 2. Because sometimes on some servers, 3 will only work for one account, or it wont work at all.

That’s incredibly fucking stupid.[/quote]

That’s for sure

[quote] How can playerRights = 3 not work? It’s just a variable name that you’re assigning the value ‘2’ to. So if you have in a command if(playerRights >= 2), then how could you not possibly use it if your playerRights are over 2? You could have playerRights = 10000 for all Java cares.
[/quote]

Those numbers have special meaning to the client :|[/quote]
Lol, btw like my new sig addition? Did it just for Alexia to get the word out <3

item.title: Admin
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:10, topic:57271”][quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=81483.msg887700#msg887700 date=1171204924]
Javaisnotrecognized… reboot and reconnecting wont do anything. Close down your server, compile, then run it again. Should work.
If that doesnt work, use playerrights as 2. Because sometimes on some servers, 3 will only work for one account, or it wont work at all.
[/quote]
That’s incredibly fucking stupid.[/quote]

That’s for sure

How can playerRights = 3 not work? It's just a variable name that you're assigning the value '2' to. So if you have in a command if(playerRights >= 2), then how could you not possibly use it if your playerRights are over 2? You could have playerRights = 10000 for all Java cares.

Those numbers have special meaning to the client
